\textbf{Note}: Forecasts provide a range of possible conditions and are presented as likelihoods of groundwater being above, below, or near normal. This analysis uses the “normal” term solely in reference to water levels between the 25th to 75th percentiles of historical data, not to imply a steady state baseline for a well. Data should be interpreted with the context of long-term records, patterns, and trends.

\columnbreak

\textbf{Disclaimer}: Groundwater level forecasts use computational models and third-party data. These models have both systematic (model limitations) and random (input data) errors. Forecasts may differ from actual observations and water levels could exceed forecast bounds. Users must accept responsibility for their use and interpretation. Real-time observed data may be subject to change.

\end{multicols}
